metadata.title: The efficacy of intranasal interferonet-2a in respiratory syncytial virus infection in volunteers

abstract.original_text: In a double-blind, placebo-controlled study, self-administered intranasal interferona-2a or placebo was given both before and after challenge with respiratory syncytial virus. The incidence of colds and the severity of signs and symptoms were reduced in those receiving interferonot-2a as compared with those given placebo.

abstract.original_text: In a further double-blind, placebo-controlled study, self-administered interferonot-2a or placebo was given only to those volunteers who developed colds following challenge with respiratory syncytial virus. There was no evidence that interferon~t-2a reduced the severity of the signs and symptoms or shortened the duration of the illness.

abstract.original_text: The similarity of these results to the effect of interferonot-2a in rhinovirus infections in volunteers is discussed.
